ch.unifr.pai.twice.dragndrop.client.intf
Interface DragNDropHandler

public interface DragNDropHandler

Drag and drop handler contract - used to define the functionality of a dragged widget.

Author:
Oliver Schmid

Method Summary

Method Detail

onStartDrag

void onStartDrag(java.lang.String deviceId,
                 com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget draggedWidget)
Invoked when the drag of a widget starts

Parameters:
deviceId - - the identifier of the device that triggered the drag
draggedWidget - - the widget which is dragged (this is the original widget and not the dragging proxy!)

onDrop

boolean onDrop(java.lang.String deviceId,
               com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget draggedWidget,
               int dragProxyLeft,
               int dragProxyTop,
               com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event,
               DropTargetHandler dropTarget,
               boolean outOfBox)
Invoked when a widget has been dropped. Please note, that the position of the widget can still be reset after that method - for final handling after a drag, use onEndOfDrop(String, Widget, int, int, Event).

Parameters:
deviceId - - the identifier of the device that triggered the drop
draggedWidget - - the widget which is dragged (this is the original widget and not the dragging proxy!)
dragProxyLeft - - the absolute left position of the proxy widget
dragProxyTop - - the absolute top position of the proxy widget
event - - the event that has caused the invocation of the onDrop (e.g. a mouse up event)
dropTarget - - the drop target or null
outOfBox - - boolean declaring if the drop happened outside of the defined boundary box
Returns:
true if the drop shall be accepted or false if it shall be rejected (and the widget shall be repositioned to its original coordinates)

onEndOfDrop

void onEndOfDrop(java.lang.String deviceId,
                 com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget draggedWidget,
                 int dragProxyLeft,
                 int dragProxyTop,
                 com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event)
Invoked at the end of the drop

Parameters:
deviceId - - the identifier of the device that triggered the drop
draggedWidget - - the widget which is dragged (this is the original widget and not the dragging proxy!)
dragProxyLeft - - the absolute left position of the proxy widget
dragProxyTop - - the absolute top position of the proxy widget
event - - the event that has caused the invocation of the onEndOfDrop (e.g. a mouse up event)
